question: [File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Pruning] [Pruning window violation] If pruning is configured to keep N versions but a bug causes N+1 versions to be deleted, can this break historical state queries and cause API failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Storage] [Compaction corruption] Can RocksDB compaction of STATE_VALUE_BY_KEY_HASH_CF_NAME introduce data corruption (bit flips, lost entries) that goes undetected until state root mismatch occurs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Pruning] [Cross-shard pruning] When pruning across 16 shards, can inconsistent pruning progress cause some shards to retain old versions while others delete them, breaking state consistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Storage] [Disk full handling] If disk space is exhausted during a write to StateValueByKeyHashSchema, does the database handle this gracefully, or can it cause corruption or loss of liveness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Pruning] [Metadata-value mismatch] Can pruning delete StateValue entries without updating corresponding metadata or indices, causing dangling references that break state queries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Truncation] [Incomplete truncation] If truncate_state_kv_db_shards() is interrupted mid-operation, can this leave some shards truncated while others retain data, causing state inconsistency? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Truncation] [Version rollback] When truncating to a specific version, does the operation correctly delete all (HashValue, Version > target) entries, or can off-by-one errors cause incorrect truncation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Database] [Batch size limit] Can a single SchemaBatch contain so many StateValueByKeyHashSchema updates that it exceeds RocksDB's write buffer size, causing write failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Truncation] [Orphaned hot state] If truncation deletes entries from STATE_VALUE_BY_KEY_HASH_CF_NAME but not HOT_STATE_VALUE_BY_KEY_HASH_CF_NAME, can this cause inconsistency between hot and cold state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Database] [Iterator consistency] Are iterators over StateValueByKeyHashSchema consistent with a snapshot at a specific version, or can ongoing writes cause iterators to see uncommitted data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Truncation] [Index cleanup] Does truncation properly clean up all related indices (StaleStateValueIndexByKeyHashSchema, etc.), or can orphaned index entries cause space leaks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Database] [Checkpoint corruption] If a database checkpoint is taken while writes to StateValueByKeyHashSchema are in progress, can this result in a corrupted checkpoint that fails restoration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Truncation] [Metadata update lag] If truncation completes but commit progress metadata is not updated atomically, can this cause validators to disagree on the current database state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Database] [Column family migration] If STATE_VALUE_BY_KEY_HASH_CF_NAME schema changes in a protocol upgrade, can old entries become unreadable, causing validators to fail state queries? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Truncation] [Partial shard truncation] Can truncation succeed on some shards but fail on others due to I/O errors, leaving the database in a partially truncated state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Merkle integrity] [State root mismatch] If StateValueByKeyHashSchema stores a StateValue but the corresponding Jellyfish Merkle tree node is not updated, can this cause state root mismatches between validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Merkle integrity] [Hash-to-key mapping] Does the schema maintain bidirectional mapping between HashValue and original StateKey, or can hash collisions cause Merkle proofs to verify incorrectly? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Merkle integrity] [Version mismatch] If a StateValue is retrieved at version N from StateValueByKeyHashSchema but the Merkle tree is at version N+1, can this cause proof verification failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Merkle integrity] [Proof generation] Can an attacker cause get_state_value_with_proof() to generate invalid Merkle proofs by exploiting inconsistencies between StateValueByKeyHashSchema and StateMerkleDb? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Merkle integrity] [Rapid hash cache] If StateValue.maybe_rapid_hash cache is stale or corrupted, can this cause Merkle tree computations to use wrong hashes, breaking state commitments? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Merkle integrity] [Deletion proofs] When a StateValue is deleted (set to None), is the Merkle tree updated correctly to reflect the deletion, or can stale Merkle nodes cause incorrect proofs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Merkle integrity] [Sparse merkle placeholder] Does the schema properly handle SPARSE_MERKLE_PLACEHOLDER_HASH for non-existent state values, or can placeholder handling bugs cause proof verification failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Merkle integrity] [Batch proof generation] When generating Merkle range proofs for multiple state values, can inconsistent versions between StateValueByKeyHashSchema entries cause partial proof failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Merkle integrity] [Sharded Merkle tree] With 16 shards, does each shard maintain a consistent Merkle subtree, or can cross-shard inconsistencies corrupt the global Merkle root? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Merkle integrity] [Proof size] Can an attacker craft a StateKey that causes Merkle proof generation from StateValueByKeyHashSchema to produce excessively large proofs, causing memory exhaustion? (Medium)
